name: Mixed Vegetable Rava Idli
history: Rava Idli, a variation of the traditional South Indian idli, is made from semolina (rava). The addition of individually specified mixed vegetables enhances its nutritional value and taste.
description: A soft and fluffy steamed cake made from semolina and yogurt, mixed with a variety of individually specified vegetables and spices. It's a quick and healthy meal option.

instructions.title: Prepare the Rava Mixture
instructions.description: Roast the rava in a dry pan until it becomes aromatic. Allow it to cool.

instructions.title: Make the Batter
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine the roasted rava, yogurt, chopped carrot, green peas, bell pepper, and water to form a batter. Let it rest for 15 minutes.

instructions.title: Temper the Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a small pan, add mustard seeds, green chilies, and curry leaves. Once they splutter, add this to the batter. Mix in salt and baking soda.

instructions.title: Steam the Idlis
instructions.description: Grease the idli moulds. Pour the batter into each mould. Steam in an idli steamer or a pressure cooker without the whistle for 10-12 minutes.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Allow the idlis to cool slightly before demoulding. Serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

tips: Ensure the batter is not too thick or too thin.
Adding a pinch of fruit salt (like Eno) can make the idlis fluffier.
variations: Include grated ginger for additional flavor.
Add chopped coriander leaves for a fresh taste.

storage.shelfLife: Batter can be stored for up to 1 day in the refrigerator
storage.instructions: Store the batter in an airtight container. Cooked idlis are best enjoyed fresh but can be refrigerated for 1-2 days.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a steamer or microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Serve on a banana leaf for an authentic South Indian experience.
Garnish with grated coconut on top for a decorative touch.
